MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code. Provide your answer with these fields. - is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false), - scenario: a specific violation scenario. Here is the code of list_directory: ```c static enum MHD_Result list_directory (struct ResponseDataContext *rdc, const char *dirname) { char fullname[PATH_MAX]; struct stat sbuf; DIR *dir; struct dirent *de; if (NULL == (dir = opendir (dirname))) return MHD_NO; while (NULL != (de = readdir (dir))) { int res; if ('.' == de->d_name[0]) continue; if (sizeof (fullname) <= (unsigned int) snprintf (fullname, sizeof (fullname), "%s/%s", dirname, de->d_name)) continue; /* ugh, file too long? how can this be!? */ if (0 != stat (fullname, &sbuf)) continue; /* ugh, failed to 'stat' */ if (! S_ISREG (sbuf.st_mode)) continue; /* not a regular file, skip */ if (rdc->off + 1024 > rdc->buf_len) { void *r; if ( (2 * rdc->buf_len + 1024) < rdc->buf_len) break; /* more than SIZE_T _index_ size? Too big for us */ rdc->buf_len = 2 * rdc->buf_len + 1024; if (NULL == (r = realloc (rdc->buf, rdc->buf_len))) break; /* out of memory */ rdc->buf = r; } res = snprintf (&rdc->buf[rdc->off], rdc->buf_len - rdc->off, "
  • %s
    • \n", fullname, de->d_name); if (0 >= res) continue; /* snprintf() error */ if (rdc->buf_len - rdc->off <= (size_t) res) continue; /* buffer too small?? */ rdc->off += (size_t) res; } (void) closedir (dir); return MHD_YES; } ```     Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze: ```c res = snprintf (&rdc->buf[rdc->off], rdc->buf_len - rdc->off, "
  • %s
    • \n", fullname, de->d_name); if (0 >= res) continue; /* snprintf() error */ if (rdc->buf_len - rdc->off <= (size_t) res) continue; /* buffer too small?? */ ``` Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
scenario: No. Both branches are reachable: if snprintf() fails or returns a negative value (encoding error) the first condition (0 >= res) is taken; if snprintf() indicates the required output size is >= the available buffer (it returns the number of characters that would have been written) the second condition (rdc->buf_len - rdc->off <= (size_t) res) is taken. Therefore there is no unreachable code in this fragment.
